DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Positron Emission Tomography Metabolic Response Status Lugano Lymphoma Response Classification Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the positron emission tomography metabolic lugano lymphoma response disease status.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Positron Emission Tomography Metabolic Response Status
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered._An evaluation of the metabolic response of the disease to the therapy._A condition or state at a particular time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredName: Positron Emission Tomography Metabolic Response Status
Property.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.:An evaluation of the metabolic response of the disease to the therapy.:A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.
An evaluation of the metabolic response of the disease to the therapy.
A condition or state at a particular time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Positron Emission Tomography Lugano Lymphoma Response Classification Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered._A lymphoma response criteria system developed at the 11th International Conference on Malignant Lymphoma (ICML) in Lugano, Switzerland, June 2011._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Continued Lugano Lymphoma Response Classification Complete Remission by PET

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Continued Lugano Lymphoma Response Classification Complete Remission by PET
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption.: A score of 1, 2, or 3 on a 5-point PET scale in nodal or extranodal sites with or without a residual mass. No evidence of FDG-avid disease in the marrow.

Concepts.definition: Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption.

Concepts.longName: Lugano Lymphoma Response Classification Complete Remission by PET
Concepts.definition: A score of 1, 2, or 3 on a 5-point PET scale in nodal or extranodal sites with or without a residual mass. No evidence of FDG-avid disease in the marrow.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates that an assessment was not performed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates that an assessment was not performed.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lugano Lymphoma Response Classification Progressive Disease by PET

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lugano Lymphoma Response Classification Progressive Disease by PET
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A score of 4 or 5 on a 5-point PET scale with an increase in intensity of uptake from baseline and/or new FDG-avid foci consistent with lymphoma at interim or end of treatment assessment.

Concepts.longName: Lugano Lymphoma Response Classification Progressive Disease by PET
Concepts.definition: A score of 4 or 5 on a 5-point PET scale with an increase in intensity of uptake from baseline and/or new FDG-avid foci consistent with lymphoma at interim or end of treatment assessment.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lugano Lymphoma Response Classification No Response/Stable Disease by PET

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lugano Lymphoma Response Classification No Response/Stable Disease by PET
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A score of 4 or 5 on a 5-point PET scale with no significant change in FDG uptake from baseline, at interim or end of treatment. No change in the bone marrow from baseline.

Concepts.longName: Lugano Lymphoma Response Classification No Response/Stable Disease by PET
Concepts.definition: A score of 4 or 5 on a 5-point PET scale with no significant change in FDG uptake from baseline, at interim or end of treatment. No change in the bone marrow from baseline.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lugano Lymphoma Response Classification Partial Remission by PET

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lugano Lymphoma Response Classification Partial Remission by PET
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A score of 4 or 5 on a 5-point PET scale with reduced uptake compared with baseline and residual mass(es) of any size. Residual uptake higher than uptake in normal marrow but reduced compared to baseline.

Concepts.longName: Lugano Lymphoma Response Classification Partial Remission by PET
Concepts.definition: A score of 4 or 5 on a 5-point PET scale with reduced uptake compared with baseline and residual mass(es) of any size. Residual uptake higher than uptake in normal marrow but reduced compared to baseline.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lugano Lymphoma Response Classification Complete Remission by PET

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lugano Lymphoma Response Classification Complete Remission by PET
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A score of 1, 2, or 3 on a 5-point PET scale in nodal or extranodal sites with or without a residual mass. No evidence of FDG-avid disease in the marrow.

Concepts.longName: Lugano Lymphoma Response Classification Complete Remission by PET
Concepts.definition: A score of 1, 2, or 3 on a 5-point PET scale in nodal or extranodal sites with or without a residual mass. No evidence of FDG-avid disease in the marrow.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Positron Emission Tomography Lugano Lymphoma Response Classification Type
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.:A lymphoma response criteria system developed at the 11th International Conference on Malignant Lymphoma (ICML) in Lugano, Switzerland, June 2011.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.
A lymphoma response criteria system developed at the 11th International Conference on Malignant Lymphoma (ICML) in Lugano, Switzerland, June 2011.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
